messages.message:
I can run apps-server fine, but api-server-apps has a lot of errors in the first run. Was the api-server-apps migration recent?
```• Installing pdfminer-six (20221210 47baa0d): Failed

  PermissionError

  [Errno 13] Permission denied: '/Users/adamlipson/Library/Caches/pypoetry/virtualenvs/api-server-apps-Sza10wTU-py3.9/src/pdfminer.six.public/.git/objects/pack'

  at ~/Library/Application Support/pypoetry/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dulwich/object_store.py:703 in _update_pack_cache
       699│ 
       700│     def _update_pack_cache(self):
       701│         """Read and iterate over new pack files and cache them."""
       702│         try:
    →  703│             pack_dir_contents = os.listdir(self.pack_dir)
       704│         except FileNotFoundError:
       705│             self.close()```

it was around dec 30 iirc, i think this is related to the migration. there’s a sporadic bug with poetry that causes the venv to be corrupted like this, I’m testing a fix and should have it in today — in the meantime you can run via docker
